title: Change default tenant
content:
In a multi-tenancy environment, you can change the default tenant at either the global or customer level.

Change global default tenant

If you want to change the global default tenant, you can perform the following steps.

Note: This operation doesn't change the default tenant of existing customers. For a newly created customer, its default tenant is set to the new value.​​​​

  1. Access the JMX Console of the Provider customer: https://<UCMDB host>:<port>/jmx-console

  2. Locate the setGlobalDefaultTenant operation in the UCMDB:service=Tenant Management Services category.

  3. In the tenantName field, type the name of the tenant to be set as the default tenant. For example, All Tenants. 

  4. Click Invoke.

  5. You can view the global default tenant by invoking the getGlobalDefaultTenant JMX method.

Change default tenant for an existing customer

To change the default tenant for an existing customer, follow these steps:

  1. In UCMDB Local Client, go to Security > Tenants Management and create a new tenant that you want to set as the default tenant manually. For example, All Tenants. 

  2. Access the JMX Console of the Provider customer: https://<UCMDB host>:<port>/jmx-console

  3. Locate the setTenantAsDefault operation in the UCMDB:service=Tenant Management Services category.

  4. In the customerID field, type the specific customer ID. For the Provider customer, you can type 1. 

  5. In the tenantName field, type the name of the tenant to be set as the default tenant of the existing customer. For example, All Tenants. 

  6. Click Invoke.

  7. You can view the default tenant of a customer by invoking the getDefaultTenant JMX method.

Update existing CIs to new default tenant  

To change the consumer tenant and owner tenant attribute values of the existing CIs to the new default tenant, follow these steps to create an enrichment rule: 

  1. From UCMDB Local Client, go to Modeling > Enrichment Manager.

  2. Click the New button, and then select New Tenant Association Rule.

  3. In Rule Name, type a rule name (for example, UpdateTenant), and then click Next.

  4. Select Base the Tenant Association Rule on a new query, and then click Finish.

  5. Drag the CI types that you want to change their tenant from the right panel in CI Type Selector to the middle panel, and then select Enrichment Mode on the top.

  6. Right-click the selected CI types, and select Update Consumer Tenants. In the opened dialog box, select the new default tenant (for example, All Tenants) to selected Tenants, and then click OK.  Repeat this step by selecting Update Owner Tenants to update the owner tenant of the selected CI types. 

  7. Save the enrichment rule.

  8. Right-click the enrichment rules, and then click Activate Rule.

  9. After all the existing CIs are updated to use the new default tenant, you can delete the original default tenant if you no longer need it. You can also deactivate this enrichment rule.
